campaigns.headline: Fun Can Change Behaviour for the Better.
campaigns.rationale: Showed how adding fun motivates positive choices.

campaigns.headline: Make the Sky the Best Place on Earth.
campaigns.whenNotToUse: When practical benefits are the focus.

campaigns.headline: Everyday, More Photos are Taken on iPhone.
Sweating Like a Pig, Feeling Like a Fox.
campaigns.rationale: Challenged stereotypes about women and fitness.
campaigns.outcome: Inspired millions of women to get active.

campaigns.headline: Rewrite the Rules.
campaigns.whenNotToUse: When tone is celebratory without critique.

campaigns.headline: The Power of Duality.
campaigns.rationale: Used interactive film to show contrasting stories.

campaigns.headline: The Hardest Job in the World is the Best Job in the World.
campaigns.outcome: One of P&G's most beloved campaigns.

campaigns.headline: Why is Laundry Only a Mother's Job?
Order a Whopper for 1Â¢ at McDonald's.
campaigns.rationale: Hijacked competitors to drive app installs.

campaigns.headline: A Glass and a Half Full of Joy.
campaigns.rationale: Used humor and surrealism to spark emotion.

campaigns.headline: We Are All the Same Inside.
Greatness is Wherever Somebody is Trying to Find It.
Mission to the Edge of Space.
People with Down Syndrome are Going Extinct.
Be Safe Around Trains.
campaigns.rationale: Used dark humor for safety education.
campaigns.outcome: Most shared public service ad ever.

campaigns.headline: The Web is What You Make of It.
Is This the Best a Man Can Get?

campaigns.campaign: The Most Interesting Man in the World
campaigns.headline: Stay Thirsty, My Friends.
campaigns.rationale: Created a legendary persona to elevate brand status.
campaigns.whenNotToUse: When tone must be strictly factual.

campaigns.headline: Find Your Magic.
campaigns.rationale: Shifted brand away from stereotypes toward individuality.
campaigns.outcome: Repositioned AXE for a new generation.
campaigns.whenNotToUse: When clarity about product function is critical.

campaigns.headline: Imported from Detroit.
campaigns.outcome: Eminem Super Bowl spot revived the brand.

campaigns.campaign: You're Not You When You're Hungry
campaigns.headline: You're Not You When You're Hungry.
Meet the Superhumans.
campaigns.outcome: Won Grand Prix for Film Craft.

campaigns.headline: If We Made It.
campaigns.whenToUse: When humor aligns with brand DNA.

campaigns.headline: Don't Let This Be My Last Selfie.
Give Someone the Christmas They've Been Dreaming Of.
Experience the Power of a Bookbook.
Search On.
campaigns.rationale: Used a love story to humanize technology.
campaigns.whenNotToUse: When focusing solely on product features.

campaigns.headline: It's Mine.
campaigns.rationale: Super Bowl ad with balloon characters.

campaigns.campaign: Good Things Come to Those Who Wait
campaigns.headline: Good Things Come to Those Who Wait.
You Are More Beautiful Than You Think.

campaigns.campaign: The Man Your Man Could Smell Like
campaigns.headline: Smell Like a Man, Man.
Think Small.
campaigns.rationale: Challenged American preference for big cars by highlighting the Beetle's small size as a virtue in honest, witty ads.
campaigns.outcome: Became the top ad campaign of the century per AdAge, boosted sales significantly.
campaigns.whenToUse: When turning perceived weaknesses into strengths with honesty.
campaigns.whenNotToUse: When promoting luxury or size as key features.

campaigns.headline: A Diamond is Forever.
campaigns.rationale: Associated diamonds with eternal love, creating the engagement ring tradition and turning diamonds into symbols of commitment.
campaigns.outcome: Dominated the market, cultural staple, AdAge top campaign.
campaigns.whenToUse: For emotional luxury items with long-term appeal.

campaigns.headline: Just Do It.
campaigns.rationale: Inspired action and perseverance, drawing from a death row inmate's words, becoming a universal mantra for athletes and beyond.
campaigns.outcome: Sales soared from $800m to $9.2b in 10 years, iconic brand slogan.
campaigns.whenNotToUse: For products promoting relaxation or passivity.

campaigns.campaign: The Man in the Hathaway Shirt
campaigns.headline: The Man in the Hathaway Shirt.
campaigns.rationale: Featured an aristocratic man with an eye patch in exotic settings, creating intrigue and positioning shirts as sophisticated.
campaigns.outcome: Revived a dying brand, AdAge top 100.

campaigns.headline: Come to Marlboro Country.
campaigns.rationale: Repositioned filtered cigarettes as masculine with rugged cowboy imagery, appealing to male consumers.
campaigns.outcome: From 1% market share to top brand, AdAge top campaign.

campaigns.headline: I \uc0頩 NY.
campaigns.rationale: Revived tourism during economic crisis with simple logo and song promoting love for the city.

campaigns.headline: Got Milk?
campaigns.rationale: Highlighted milk's absence in humorous scenarios, making it essential.
campaigns.outcome: Sales increase in California, celebrity endorsements.

campaigns.headline: Think Different.
campaigns.rationale: Celebrated rebels and innovators like Einstein to revive Apple's image as innovative.
campaigns.outcome: Stock rise, brand revival, Emmy win.

campaigns.headline: Wassup?
campaigns.rationale: Friends greeting with 'Wassup?' captured casual friendship, becoming cultural phenomenon.
campaigns.outcome: Super Bowl hit, sales boost, parodies.

campaigns.headline: Red Bull Gives You Wings.
campaigns.rationale: Positioned as ultimate energy boost with cartoon ads showing exaggerated effects.

campaigns.headline: We Try Harder.
campaigns.rationale: As #2 car rental, promised better service than #1 Hertz.
campaigns.outcome: Market share from 11% to 35%, AdAge top.

campaigns.headline: Where's the Beef?
campaigns.rationale: Elderly lady mocked competitors' small patties, emphasizing Wendy's larger burgers.

campaigns.headline: Why 1984 Won't Be Like '1984'.
campaigns.rationale: Dystopian ad positioned Macintosh as liberation from IBM's conformity.
campaigns.outcome: Super Bowl icon, sales boost, AdAge #2.

campaigns.headline: I'd Like to Buy the World a Coke.
campaigns.rationale: Promoted harmony with diverse singers during Vietnam era.

campaigns.headline: Absolut Perfection.
campaigns.rationale: Artistic ads featuring bottle in creative settings.

campaigns.headline: Lemon.
campaigns.rationale: Highlighted quality control by calling imperfect cars 'lemons'.
campaigns.outcome: Revolutionized honest ads, market share growth.

campaigns.headline: The Swedish Number.
campaigns.rationale: Launching a unique tourism campaign with a national phone number where random Swedes answer calls for authentic info.
campaigns.outcome: Over 9 billion media impressions, phone number still in operation, Cannes Lion Grand Prix.
campaigns.whenToUse: For tourism campaigns seeking unique, personal engagement.
campaigns.whenNotToUse: If the concept is too unconventional for the target audience.

campaigns.headline: True Name'99.
campaigns.rationale: Allowing trans and non-binary people to choose their bank card name to address discrimination by reflecting true identity.
campaigns.outcome: Won Cannes Lion Grand Prix, Mastercard's first.
campaigns.whenToUse: For campaigns supporting trans and non-binary inclusion.
campaigns.whenNotToUse: If the audience is not supportive of transgender issues.

campaigns.headline: Raising Profiles.
campaigns.rationale: Creating online social accounts for Big Issue sellers post-COVID to help find new buyers and increase sales.
campaigns.outcome: Revolutionized sales model, won Cannes Lion Grand Prix.
campaigns.whenToUse: For social impact campaigns aiding marginalized groups.
campaigns.whenNotToUse: If digital literacy is not a feasible solution.

campaigns.headline: The Breakaway.
campaigns.rationale: Connecting prisoners to the outside world via online cycling using Zwift to make a positive impact on incarcerated individuals.
campaigns.outcome: Reached over a million on social media, won two Cannes Lions Grand Prix, expanded to 30 prisons.
campaigns.whenToUse: For campaigns aiming to rehabilitate or connect marginalized groups.
campaigns.whenNotToUse: If the audience is not interested in prison reform.

campaigns.headline: Liquid Billboard.
campaigns.rationale: Turning a billboard into a shared pool to showcase inclusive swimwear and address discomfort in swimming.
campaigns.outcome: Won Cannes Lions Grand Prix, Gold Lion, two Silver Lions, one Bronze.
campaigns.whenToUse: For campaigns promoting inclusivity in sports or fashion.

campaigns.headline: Courage Is Beautiful.
campaigns.rationale: Created during the coronavirus outbreak to honor the devotion and courage of medical workers, showing them fatigued and exhausted but emphasizing their beauty through courage.
campaigns.outcome: Received international acclaim and was awarded the Cannes Lions Grand Prix.

campaigns.headline: Black Supermarket.
campaigns.rationale: Protested a law limiting farm product sales to 3%, creating
organic veggies and fruits to advocate for consumer rights and organic products.
campaigns.outcome: Led to the adoption of a new law lifting restrictions on organic product sales and won the Cannes Lions Grand Prix in the Creative Efficiency category.

campaigns.headline: The Displaced.
campaigns.rationale: A VR film telling the stories of three displaced children from Syria, Ukraine, and South Sudan to immerse viewers in the refugee crisis and highlight the lives of 60 million refugees, half of whom are children.
campaigns.outcome: Received positive feedback from viewers and won the main prize at Cannes, along with other awards.

campaigns.headline: The Epic Split.
campaigns.rationale: Part of the Live Test series, demonstrated truck stability and precision with Jean-Claude Van Damme doing a split between moving trucks, set to Enya's
campaigns.outcome: Achieved over 100 million views in two years, won 20 Cannes Lions including two Grand Prix and eight Golden Lions.

campaigns.headline: Be Safe Around Trains.
campaigns.rationale: A cartoon promoting safe metro behavior through humorous depictions of ridiculous ways to die, including reckless metro actions, to engage without boring the audience.
campaigns.outcome: Viewed 28 million times in two weeks, charted in the top 10 on iTunes, expanded into a mobile game and merch, and won 28 Cannes Lions including five Grand Prix in 2013.
campaigns.whenToUse: For public safety with viral humor.

campaigns.brand: Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences
campaigns.headline: Caption with Intention.
campaigns.rationale: Reimagining how deaf and hard-of-hearing audiences experience film and television.
campaigns.outcome: Won two Grand Prix in design and digital craft, two Gold Lions, one Silver Lion, and a bronze in creative B2B. Total of 12 Lions, including a Titanium Lion.
campaigns.whenToUse: For accessibility and innovation in media.

campaigns.headline: Preserved Promos.
campaigns.rationale: Allowed shoppers to upload photos of expired food coupons to unlock discounts on groceries, requiring Ziploc in their cart.
campaigns.outcome: Won a Grand Prix in creative commerce, gold in direct, and multiple silvers and bronzes across creative B2B and media. Total of 24 Lions.
campaigns.whenToUse: For direct, interactive grocery discount systems.

campaigns.headline: Tracking Bad Bunny.
campaigns.rationale: Turned Bad Bunny's album launch into a global virtual scavenger hunt celebrating Puerto Rican culture.
campaigns.outcome: Won a Grand Prix in Entertainment Lions for Music.

campaigns.headline: Haaland Payback Time.
campaigns.rationale: Wove together sport, gaming, and pop culture, debuting Erling Haaland as a playable in-game character.
campaigns.outcome: Won a Grand Prix in Entertainment Lions for Sport.

campaigns.campaign: Real Beauty Redefined for the AI Era
campaigns.headline: Real Beauty Redefined for the AI Era.
campaigns.rationale: Focused on redefining beauty standards in the context of AI.
campaigns.outcome: Won a Grand Prix in media.

campaigns.headline: Act Like You Know.
campaigns.rationale: Targeted B2B audience with a campaign emphasizing knowledge and action.
campaigns.outcome: Won a Grand Prix in creative B2B.

campaigns.headline: Shot on iPhone.
campaigns.rationale: Highlighted the creative capabilities of iPhone photography.
campaigns.outcome: Won a Grand Prix in creative effectiveness.
campaigns.whenToUse: For user-generated content showcasing product features.

campaigns.headline: Three Words.
campaigns.rationale: Addressed domestic violence with powerful messaging to encourage action.
campaigns.outcome: Won Cannes Lions Dan Wieden Titanium Grand Prix.
campaigns.whenToUse: For social good campaigns tackling sensitive issues.

campaigns.headline: Real Beauty.
campaigns.rationale: Built a global movement on self-esteem, challenging beauty standards.
campaigns.outcome: Won Cannes Lions Creative Business Transformation Grand Prix.
campaigns.whenToUse: For long-term brand purpose on social issues.

campaigns.headline: Vaseline Verified.
campaigns.rationale: Tested and verified skin care hacks in labs to build trust.
campaigns.outcome: Won Cannes Lions Health and Wellness Grand Prix, Titanium Lion.
campaigns.whenToUse: For product credibility through science and humor.

campaigns.headline: Who told you the earth was warming'85 Chicken Little?
campaigns.rationale: proof, inaccurate climate models, and asserted that the physics was
aiming to reposition global warming as theory, not fact.
campaigns.outcome: Contributed to climate denial efforts in the 1990s.

campaigns.headline: Lies they tell our children.
campaigns.rationale: Suggested climate change claims were misleading, part of a broader campaign to downplay the seriousness of the climate crisis.
campaigns.outcome: Part of Mobil's long-running denial ads.
campaigns.whenToUse: For misdirection in controversial industries (ethically questionable).

campaigns.headline: Apocalypse no.
campaigns.rationale: Downplayed the seriousness of climate change, suggesting it was not a significant threat.

campaigns.headline: What we don't know.
campaigns.rationale: Questioned whether the climate crisis is real and human-made, emphasizing scientific uncertainty, timed with the UN Kyoto negotiations.
campaigns.outcome: Influenced public opinion during Kyoto talks.
campaigns.whenToUse: For delaying action on issues (ethically questionable).

campaigns.headline: Unsettled Science.
campaigns.rationale: Continued to downplay the seriousness of climate change by emphasizing scientific uncertainty, appearing in multiple publications.

campaigns.headline: United Colors of Benetton.
campaigns.rationale: Gained worldwide attention for its advertising, inspired by art director Oliviero Toscani, focusing on multicultural themes, interracial groupings, and provocative sexual images, such as a nun kissing a priest, to challenge social norms and promote diversity.
campaigns.outcome: The campaign became internationally recognized, enhancing Benetton's global brand image, though it was controversial for its provocative nature.
campaigns.whenToUse: For challenging social norms and promoting diversity.
campaigns.whenNotToUse: When avoiding controversy or in conservative markets.

campaigns.campaign: If only I had a son
campaigns.headline: If only I had a son.
campaigns.rationale: The campaign portrayed a dark-skinned daughter using Fair & Lovely cream to become light-skinned and successful, aiming to appeal to cultural preferences for fair skin and gender roles, targeting middle-class Indian consumers.
campaigns.outcome: Faced widespread protests for perpetuating gender discrimination and skin color bias, leading to cancellation by Hindustan Lever Ltd. after complaints from the All India Women's Democratic Association and government intervention under the Cable and Television Networks Act of 1995.

campaigns.headline: The Partnership That Changed Everything.
campaigns.rationale: Showcased transformative partnership, emphasizing innovation and luxury.
campaigns.outcome: Cannes Lions Grand Prix in Brand Experience and Activation.

campaigns.headline: Three Words.
campaigns.rationale: Addressed domestic violence with powerful messaging to encourage action.
campaigns.outcome: Cannes Lions Dan Wieden Titanium Grand Prix.
campaigns.whenToUse: For social good campaigns tackling sensitive issues.

campaigns.campaign: Real Beauty: How a Soap Brand Created a Global Self-Esteem Movement
campaigns.headline: Real Beauty.
campaigns.rationale: Built a global movement on self-esteem, challenging beauty standards.
campaigns.outcome: Cannes Lions Creative Business Transformation Grand Prix.
campaigns.whenToUse: For long-term brand purpose on social issues.

campaigns.headline: Vaseline Verified.
campaigns.rationale: Tested and verified skin care hacks in labs to build trust.
campaigns.outcome: Cannes Lions Health and Wellness Grand Prix, Titanium Lion.
campaigns.whenToUse: For product credibility through science and humor.

campaigns.headline: Name This Oreo.
campaigns.rationale: Engaged users in naming new flavors through voice activation.
campaigns.outcome: Gold in Voice Activation, Branded Content.

campaigns.headline: The Shakespeare BIC.
campaigns.rationale: Celebrated writing with Shakespeare-inspired pen designs.
campaigns.whenToUse: For cultural ties to product use.

campaigns.headline: It's Like You Know.
campaigns.rationale: Focused on B2B insights and familiarity in business relationships.
campaigns.outcome: Grand Prix for Creative B2B Integrated.

campaigns.headline: Courage Is Beautiful.
campaigns.rationale: Honored healthcare workers' faces marked by masks during COVID.

campaigns.headline: Black Supermarket.
campaigns.rationale: Sold 'illegal' seeds to push for biodiversity law change.

campaigns.headline: The Displaced.
campaigns.rationale: VR film on refugee children to highlight crisis.

campaigns.headline: The Epic Split.
campaigns.rationale: Van Damme split between trucks to show stability.

campaigns.headline: TwitchCon Invites.
campaigns.rationale: Built anticipation for event with highlights and activities.

campaigns.headline: Don't Make Duo Angry - Learn a Language in 2024.
campaigns.rationale: Used mascot to motivate New Year resolutions.

campaigns.headline: Welcome to Shutterstock 2024.
campaigns.rationale: Encouraged exploration with visuals and AI tools.

campaigns.headline: Pokemon x Van Gogh.
campaigns.rationale: Merged pop culture with art for merchandise.

campaigns.headline: Liquid Death x Rebel Moon.
campaigns.rationale: Parodied beer ads with movie tie-in.

campaigns.headline: T-Mobile's Super Bowl Ad.
campaigns.rationale: Used celebrities and '80s song for home internet promo.

campaigns.headline: Bumble for Friends Only.
campaigns.rationale: Launched app for platonic friendships, expanding from dating.

campaigns.headline: The Moldy Whopper.
campaigns.rationale: Showed a burger molding over time to highlight no artificial preservatives.
campaigns.outcome: Generated massive buzz, Cannes Grand Prix, increased brand perception for natural ingredients.
campaigns.whenToUse: To emphasize clean, natural products in a bold way.
campaigns.whenNotToUse: When audiences are sensitive to visuals of decay or food waste.

campaigns.headline: The Partnership That Changed Everything.
campaigns.rationale: Showcased transformative partnership, emphasizing innovation and luxury.
campaigns.outcome: Cannes Lions Grand Prix in Brand Experience and Activation.

campaigns.rationale: Addressed domestic violence with powerful messaging to encourage action.
campaigns.outcome: Cannes Lions Dan Wieden Titanium Grand Prix.

campaigns.campaign: If only I had a son
campaigns.headline: If only I had a son.
campaigns.rationale: The campaign portrayed a dark-skinned daughter using Fair & Lovely cream to become light-skinned and successful, aiming to appeal to cultural preferences for fair skin and gender roles, targeting middle-class Indian consumers.
campaigns.outcome: Faced widespread protests for perpetuating gender discrimination and skin color bias, leading to cancellation by Hindustan Lever Ltd. after complaints from the All India Women's Democratic Association and government intervention under the Cable and Television Networks Act of 1995.

campaigns.headline: Mikey Likes It.
campaigns.rationale: Featured a picky eater, Mikey, surprisingly liking Life Cereal, appealing to parents with fussy kids.
campaigns.outcome: Became a cultural icon, boosted sales, ran for 12 years.
campaigns.whenToUse: For family-oriented products with relatable child characters.

campaigns.headline: Have It Your Way.
campaigns.rationale: Emphasized customization to differentiate from competitors like McDonald's.
campaigns.whenToUse: For customizable products to empower consumers.

campaigns.headline: Take the Pepsi Challenge.
campaigns.rationale: Blind taste tests showed preference for Pepsi over Coke, creating rivalry.
campaigns.whenNotToUse: When avoiding legal risks or confrontations.

campaigns.headline: Don't Leave Home Without It.
campaigns.rationale: Positioned Amex as essential for travelers, featuring celebrities.

campaigns.headline: Come to Marlboro Country.
campaigns.rationale: Repositioned cigarettes as masculine with cowboy imagery.
campaigns.outcome: From women's brand to top seller, AdAge #1.

campaigns.headline: I'd Like to Buy the World a Coke.
campaigns.rationale: Promoted unity with diverse youth singing on a hilltop.
campaigns.outcome: Hit song, cultural icon, sales boost.
campaigns.whenToUse: For global harmony in turbulent times.
